cards.flavor: In dark times, Truth bears a blade.
cards.name: Archon of Justice
cards.text:
Flying
When Archon of Justice dies, exile target permanent.

cards.flavor: No matter how large or small, fierce or fleeting, the kithkin have a trap for it.
cards.name: Ballynock Trapper
cards.text:
{T}: Tap target creature.
Whenever you cast a white spell, you may untap Ballynock Trapper.

cards.flavor: The more the scarier.
cards.name: Cenn's Enlistment
cards.text:
Put two 1/1 white Kithkin Soldier creature tokens onto the battlefield.
Retrace (You may cast this card from your graveyard by discarding a land card in addition to paying its other costs.)

cards.name: Endless Horizons
cards.text:
When Endless Horizons enters the battlefield, search your library for any number of Plains cards and exile them. Then shuffle your library.
At the beginning of your upkeep, you may put a card you own exiled with Endless Horizons into your hand.

cards.flavor: The Aurora had lessened the kithkins' kindness, deepened their paranoia, and dulled their sense of pain.
cards.name: Endure
cards.text: Prevent all damage that would be dealt to you and permanents you control this turn.

cards.flavor: Its wings disturb more than air.
cards.name: Flickerwisp
cards.text:
Flying
When Flickerwisp enters the battlefield, exile another target permanent. Return that card to the battlefield under its owner's control at the beginning of the next end step.

cards.flavor:
"I'd rather hear the screams of battle than the quiet that follows."
—Talara, elvish safewright
cards.name: Hallowed Burial
cards.text: Put all creatures on the bottom of their owners' libraries.

cards.name: Kithkin Spellduster
cards.text:
Flying
{1}{W}, Sacrifice Kithkin Spellduster: Destroy target enchantment.
Persist (When this creature dies, if it had no -1/-1 counters on it, return it to the battlefield under its owner's control with a -1/-1 counter on it.)

cards.flavor: The more his flock fears, the more power he wields.
cards.name: Kithkin Zealot
cards.text: When Kithkin Zealot enters the battlefield, you gain 1 life for each black and/or red permanent target opponent controls.

cards.flavor:
"Muscle does not make one strong. It only masks the soul's light. True strength lies in purity of purpose."
—Donal Alloway, cenn of Kinscaer
cards.name: Light from Within
cards.text: Chroma — Each creature you control gets +1/+1 for each white mana symbol in its mana cost.

cards.flavor: It's tethered not to keep it from fleeing but to keep it from eating everything in sight.
cards.name: Loyal Gyrfalcon
cards.text:
Defender, flying
Whenever you cast a white spell, Loyal Gyrfalcon loses defender until end of turn.

cards.flavor: Many a keen-eared bogle has run afoul of a clever and silently orchestrated kithkin ambush.
cards.name: Patrol Signaler
cards.text: {1}{W}, {Q}: Put a 1/1 white Kithkin Soldier creature token onto the battlefield. ({Q} is the untap symbol.)

cards.flavor: Kithkin somnomancers enjoy the peaceful dreams wafting from their victims.
cards.name: Recumbent Bliss
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature can't attack or block.
At the beginning of your upkeep, you may gain 1 life.

cards.flavor: Thieves know that a snarl in the night means, "Rob another house."
cards.name: Spirit of the Hearth
cards.text:
Flying
You have hexproof. (You can't be the target of spells or abilities your opponents control.)

cards.flavor: "Better for a doun to lose its cenn than its springjacks."
cards.name: Springjack Shepherd
cards.text: Chroma — When Springjack Shepherd enters the battlefield, put a 0/1 white Goat creature token onto the battlefield for each white mana symbol in the mana costs of permanents you control.

cards.flavor: Is her need to heal born out of compassion or penance?
cards.name: Suture Spirit
cards.text:
Flying
{W/B}{W/B}{W/B}: Regenerate target creature.

cards.flavor: Suddenly he realized that everything was connected by invisible strings, strings that could be pulled—or cut.
cards.name: Banishing Knack
cards.text: Until end of turn, target creature gains "{T}: Return target nonland permanent to its owner's hand."

cards.flavor: What the current doesn't take, they do.
cards.name: Cache Raiders
cards.text: At the beginning of your upkeep, return a permanent you control to its owner's hand.

cards.flavor:
"Creation is a paradox. It hatches from its opposite."
—Olka, Mistmeadow witch
cards.name: Dream Fracture
cards.text:
Counter target spell. Its controller draws a card.
Draw a card.

cards.flavor: Awylla's salvaged dreams would finally be put to good use.
cards.name: Dream Thief
cards.text:
Flying
When Dream Thief enters the battlefield, draw a card if you've cast another blue spell this turn.

cards.name: Glamerdye
cards.text:
Change the text of target spell or permanent by replacing all instances of one color word with another.
Retrace (You may cast this card from your graveyard by discarding a land card in addition to paying its other costs.)

cards.name: Glen Elendra Archmage
cards.text:
Flying
{U}, Sacrifice Glen Elendra Archmage: Counter target noncreature spell.
Persist (When this creature dies, if it had no -1/-1 counters on it, return it to the battlefield under its owner's control with a -1/-1 counter on it.)

cards.flavor: Inspiration strikes the uncluttered mind.
cards.name: Idle Thoughts
cards.text: {2}: Draw a card if you have no cards in hand.

cards.flavor: "You should see your face right now."
cards.name: Indigo Faerie
cards.text:
Flying
{U}: Target permanent becomes blue in addition to its other colors until end of turn.

cards.flavor: "For years, the landfolk have emptied their refuse into the waters. It's time to return the favor."
cards.name: Inundate
cards.text: Return all nonblue creatures to their owners' hands.

cards.flavor: He fancies himself a master thief, claiming to "steal the ground" from his victims.
cards.name: Merrow Levitator
cards.text:
{T}: Target creature gains flying until end of turn.
Whenever you cast a blue spell, you may untap Merrow Levitator.

cards.flavor: Oona grants her favored subjects a dream from her own guarded heart.
cards.name: Oona's Grace
cards.text:
Target player draws a card.
Retrace (You may cast this card from your graveyard by discarding a land card in addition to paying its other costs.)

cards.flavor: Once you have been marked by the merrow, you are not long for their waters.
cards.name: Razorfin Abolisher
cards.text: {1}{U}, {T}: Return target creature with a counter on it to its owner's hand.

cards.name: Sanity Grinding
cards.text: Chroma — Reveal the top ten cards of your library. For each blue mana symbol in the mana costs of the revealed cards, target opponent puts the top card of his or her library into his or her graveyard. Then put the cards you revealed this way on the bottom of your library in any order.

cards.flavor: Change is a denizen of Shadowmoor as much as ouphes and noggles are.
cards.name: Talonrend
cards.text:
Flying
{U/R}: Talonrend gets +1/-1 until end of turn.

cards.flavor: Anyone who thinks merrows have more brains than brawn has never been run over by one.
cards.name: Wake Thrasher
cards.text: Whenever a permanent you control becomes untapped, Wake Thrasher gets +1/+1 until end of turn.

cards.flavor:
"I felt as if I were moving in brackish water, as if I were drowning, even though I knew I stood on dry land."
—Dindun of Kulrath Mine
cards.name: Wilderness Hypnotist
cards.text: {T}: Target red or green creature gets -2/-0 until end of turn.

cards.flavor: The Aurora had transformed her into a relentless force of destruction.
cards.name: Ashling, the Extinguisher
cards.text: Whenever Ashling, the Extinguisher deals combat damage to a player, choose target creature that player controls. He or she sacrifices that creature.

cards.flavor: Some eat the living. Some eat the dead. It eats the past.
cards.name: Creakwood Ghoul
cards.text: {B/G}{B/G}: Exile target card from a graveyard. You gain 1 life.

cards.flavor:
"I was there to watch my brothers' quenching. I drew the slightest warmth from their dying rage."
—Illulia of Nighthearth
cards.name: Crumbling Ashes
cards.text: At the beginning of your upkeep, destroy target creature with a -1/-1 counter on it.

cards.flavor: The bogeyman doesn't disappear when you close your eyes.
cards.name: Lingering Tormentor
cards.text:
Fear (This creature can't be blocked except by artifact creatures and/or black creatures.)
Persist (When this creature dies, if it had no -1/-1 counters on it, return it to the battlefield under its owner's control with a -1/-1 counter on it.)

cards.flavor: Banished to the Dark Meanders for hideous crimes, some merrows find a taste for the darkness . . . and the dead.
cards.name: Merrow Bonegnawer
cards.text:
{T}: Target player exiles a card from his or her graveyard.
Whenever you cast a black spell, you may untap Merrow Bonegnawer.

cards.name: Necroskitter
cards.text:
Wither (This deals damage to creatures in the form of -1/-1 counters.)
Whenever a creature an opponent controls with a -1/-1 counter on it dies, you may return that card to the battlefield under your control.

cards.name: Needle Specter
cards.text:
Flying
Wither (This deals damage to creatures in the form of -1/-1 counters.)
Whenever Needle Specter deals combat damage to a player, that player discards that many cards.

cards.name: Nightmare Incursion
cards.text: Search target player's library for up to X cards, where X is the number of Swamps you control, and exile them. Then that player shuffles his or her library.

cards.flavor: It plucks away memories like choice bits of carrion.
cards.name: Raven's Crime
cards.text:
Target player discards a card.
Retrace (You may cast this card from your graveyard by discarding a land card in addition to paying its other costs.)

cards.flavor: A cinder's axe bears no marks from parrying a foe's blade.
cards.name: Smoldering Butcher
cards.text: Wither (This deals damage to creatures in the form of -1/-1 counters.)

cards.flavor:
"If one gets in your chimney, you're going to need a long wick and a barrel of bangstuff to get it out."
—Hob Heddil
cards.name: Soot Imp
cards.text:
Flying
Whenever a player casts a nonblack spell, that player loses 1 life.

cards.flavor: Their thoughtweft carried Darial's last thoughts back to his doun. They sorely wished it had not.
cards.name: Soul Reap
cards.text: Destroy target nongreen creature. Its controller loses 3 life if you've cast another black spell this turn.

cards.flavor: They once sought to unite with the flame of transcendence. Now they seek only to extinguish the lights of others.
cards.name: Soul Snuffers
cards.text: When Soul Snuffers enters the battlefield, put a -1/-1 counter on each creature.

cards.flavor: Leeches never tire of feeding.
cards.name: Syphon Life
cards.text:
Target player loses 2 life and you gain 2 life.
Retrace (You may cast this card from your graveyard by discarding a land card in addition to paying its other costs.)

cards.flavor:
"Your thoughts betray you."
—Illulia of Nighthearth
cards.name: Talara's Bane
cards.text: Target opponent reveals his or her hand. You choose a green or white creature card from it. You gain life equal to that creature card's toughness, then that player discards that card.

cards.flavor: Don't venture into the darkness, lest it decide not to let you leave.
cards.name: Umbra Stalker
cards.text: Chroma — Umbra Stalker's power and toughness are each equal to the number of black mana symbols in the mana costs of cards in your graveyard.

cards.flavor: The concept of thoughtweft fascinates the Nighthearth cult. Imagine, bringing agony to an entire people by torturing just one.
cards.name: Chaotic Backlash
cards.text: Chaotic Backlash deals damage to target player equal to twice the number of white and/or blue permanents he or she controls.

cards.flavor: "If the whole world burns, I'll never grow cold."
cards.name: Cinder Pyromancer
cards.text:
{T}: Cinder Pyromancer deals 1 damage to target player.
Whenever you cast a red spell, you may untap Cinder Pyromancer.

cards.flavor: Duergars who grow too large to live in the tunnels are sent topside to defend the entrances from intruders.
cards.name: Duergar Cave-Guard
cards.text:
Wither (This deals damage to creatures in the form of -1/-1 counters.)
{R/W}: Duergar Cave-Guard gets +1/+0 until end of turn.

cards.flavor: It kills two beasts with one thrown.
cards.name: Fiery Bombardment
cards.text: Chroma — {2}, Sacrifice a creature: Fiery Bombardment deals damage to target creature or player equal to the number of red mana symbols in the sacrificed creature's mana cost.

cards.flavor:
"Fire's out. Should be safe now."
—Gnarltrunk
cards.name: Flame Jab
cards.text:
Flame Jab deals 1 damage to target creature or player.
Retrace (You may cast this card from your graveyard by discarding a land card in addition to paying its other costs.)

cards.flavor: "It's not much for eating, but I think we can find somethin' to do with it."
cards.name: Hatchet Bully
cards.text: {2}{R}, {T}, Put a -1/-1 counter on a creature you control: Hatchet Bully deals 2 damage to target creature or player.

cards.flavor: It has no safe side.
cards.name: Hateflayer
cards.text:
Wither (This deals damage to creatures in the form of -1/-1 counters.)
{2}{R}, {Q}: Hateflayer deals damage equal to its power to target creature or player. ({Q} is the untap symbol.)

cards.name: Heartlash Cinder
cards.text:
Haste
Chroma — When Heartlash Cinder enters the battlefield, it gets +X/+0 until end of turn, where X is the number of red mana symbols in the mana costs of permanents you control.

cards.flavor: As he races the moon each night, he draws a glowing equator across the world.
cards.name: Hotheaded Giant
cards.text:
Haste
Hotheaded Giant enters the battlefield with two -1/-1 counters on it unless you've cast another red spell this turn.

cards.name: Impelled Giant
cards.text:
Trample
Tap an untapped red creature you control other than Impelled Giant: Impelled Giant gets +X/+0 until end of turn, where X is the power of the creature tapped this way.

cards.flavor: A boggart's mind is a tinderbox of volatile thoughts, hungry for a spark.
cards.name: Outrage Shaman
cards.text: Chroma — When Outrage Shaman enters the battlefield, it deals damage to target creature equal to the number of red mana symbols in the mana costs of permanents you control.

cards.flavor: Gnarltrunk didn't remember having quite that many knotholes.
cards.name: Puncture Blast
cards.text:
Wither (This deals damage to creatures in the form of -1/-1 counters.)
Puncture Blast deals 3 damage to target creature or player.

cards.name: Rekindled Flame
cards.text:
Rekindled Flame deals 4 damage to target creature or player.
At the beginning of your upkeep, if an opponent has no cards in hand, you may return Rekindled Flame from your graveyard to your hand.

cards.flavor: The Extinguisher's curse lasted long after her departure.
cards.name: Stigma Lasher
cards.text:
Wither (This deals damage to creatures in the form of -1/-1 counters.)
Whenever Stigma Lasher deals damage to a player, that player can't gain life for the rest of the game.

cards.name: Thunderblust
cards.text:
Haste
Thunderblust has trample as long as it has a -1/-1 counter on it.
Persist (When this creature dies, if it had no -1/-1 counters on it, return it to the battlefield under its owner's control with a -1/-1 counter on it.)

cards.flavor: Frorn didn't want to be kept, but he didn't want to be thrown back either.
cards.name: Unwilling Recruit
cards.text: Gain control of target creature until end of turn. Untap that creature. It gets +X/+0 and gains haste until end of turn.

cards.name: Aerie Ouphes
cards.text:
Sacrifice Aerie Ouphes: Aerie Ouphes deals damage equal to its power to target creature with flying.
Persist (When this creature dies, if it had no -1/-1 counters on it, return it to the battlefield under its owner's control with a -1/-1 counter on it.)

cards.flavor: Beauty is a seed, waiting to blossom under her capable hands.
cards.name: Bloom Tender
cards.text: {T}: For each color among permanents you control, add one mana of that color to your mana pool.

cards.flavor:
"Last time, it tore up the Wilt-Leaf, turned Mistmeadow into a mudhole, and made the river jump its banks. On the bright side, we were eating venison for weeks."
—Donal Alloway, cenn of Kinscaer
cards.name: Duskdale Wurm
cards.text: Trample (If this creature would assign enough damage to its blockers to destroy them, you may have it assign the rest of its damage to defending player or planeswalker.)

cards.name: Helix Pinnacle
cards.text:
Shroud (This enchantment can't be the target of spells or abilities.)
{X}: Put X tower counters on Helix Pinnacle.
At the beginning of your upkeep, if there are 100 or more tower counters on Helix Pinnacle, you win the game.

cards.flavor: When giants rise from their long slumbers, they rarely remember how fragile the waking world can be.
cards.name: Marshdrinker Giant
cards.text: When Marshdrinker Giant enters the battlefield, destroy target Island or Swamp an opponent controls.

cards.flavor: Gackt came to regret keeping his pet toads on his head.
cards.name: Monstrify
cards.text:
Target creature gets +4/+4 until end of turn.
Retrace (You may cast this card from your graveyard by discarding a land card in addition to paying its other costs.)

cards.flavor: Though Shadowmoor's monster-haunted wilds beckon, she never leaves her post.
cards.name: Nettle Sentinel
cards.text:
Nettle Sentinel doesn't untap during your untap step.
Whenever you cast a green spell, you may untap Nettle Sentinel.

cards.flavor: The boggarts gorged themselves until their bellies glowed.
cards.name: Phosphorescent Feast
cards.text: Chroma — Reveal any number of cards in your hand. You gain 2 life for each green mana symbol in those cards' mana costs.

cards.flavor: When nature is backed into a corner, just like its children, it lashes out.
cards.name: Primalcrux
cards.text:
Trample
Chroma — Primalcrux's power and toughness are each equal to the number of green mana symbols in the mana costs of permanents you control.

cards.flavor: It rarely moves, standing stock still in its clearing. When it does stir, ravens stop their cawing and crickets their chirping. All of nature watches in awed silence.
cards.name: Regal Force
cards.text: When Regal Force enters the battlefield, draw a card for each green creature you control.

cards.flavor: Some beasts are born not of a mother, but of magic.
cards.name: Savage Conception
cards.text:
Put a 3/3 green Beast creature token onto the battlefield.
Retrace (You may cast this card from your graveyard by discarding a land card in addition to paying its other costs.)

cards.flavor: After its encounter with the spriggan, the patrol was red with anger, green with envy, white with fear, and painfully black and blue.
cards.name: Swirling Spriggan
cards.text: {G/U}{G/U}: Target creature you control becomes the color or colors of your choice until end of turn.

cards.flavor: The safewright Talara protects a delicate woodland waterfall. She has vowed to send wave after wave of warriors to slay any who would dare disturb its beauty.
cards.name: Talara's Battalion
cards.text:
Trample
Cast Talara's Battalion only if you've cast another green spell this turn.

cards.flavor: He digs his roots into barren ground, searching for old seeds that never had the chance to sprout.
cards.name: Tilling Treefolk
cards.text: When Tilling Treefolk enters the battlefield, you may return up to two target land cards from your graveyard to your hand.

cards.flavor: Righteous anger hones a humble soul.
cards.name: Twinblade Slasher
cards.text:
Wither (This deals damage to creatures in the form of -1/-1 counters.)
{1}{G}: Twinblade Slasher gets +2/+2 until end of turn. Activate this ability only once each turn.

cards.flavor: "Living scarecrows make a mockery of the natural order. Dead ones make fine hats."
cards.name: Wickerbough Elder
cards.text:
Wickerbough Elder enters the battlefield with a -1/-1 counter on it.
{G}, Remove a -1/-1 counter from Wickerbough Elder: Destroy target artifact or enchantment.

cards.name: Batwing Brume
cards.text: Prevent all combat damage that would be dealt this turn if {W} was spent to cast Batwing Brume. Each player loses 1 life for each attacking creature he or she controls if {B} was spent to cast Batwing Brume. (Do both if {W}{B} was spent.)

cards.flavor: When a graveyard is full, the gwyllions rattle the tombs and unleash the spirits into the sky.
cards.name: Beckon Apparition
cards.text: Exile target card from a graveyard. Put a 1/1 white and black Spirit creature token with flying onto the battlefield.

cards.flavor:
"Only a knife left for a fortnight in the hollow of a ghastbark tree can inflict a wound so grave."
—Kithkin superstition
cards.name: Bloodied Ghost
cards.text:
Flying
Bloodied Ghost enters the battlefield with a -1/-1 counter on it.

cards.name: Cauldron Haze
cards.text: Choose any number of target creatures. Each of those creatures gains persist until end of turn. (When it dies, if it had no -1/-1 counters on it, return it to the battlefield under its owner's control with a -1/-1 counter on it.)

cards.name: Deathbringer Liege
cards.text:
Other white creatures you control get +1/+1.
Other black creatures you control get +1/+1.
Whenever you cast a white spell, you may tap target creature.
Whenever you cast a black spell, you may destroy target creature if it's tapped.

cards.flavor:
"She spoke of mystery and portent, of such unfathomable things that my mind screamed for pity."
—The Seer's Parables
cards.name: Divinity of Pride
cards.text:
Flying, lifelink
Divinity of Pride gets +4/+4 as long as you have 25 or more life.

cards.flavor: The divinity's patronage confers both wicked grace and graceful wickedness.
cards.name: Edge of the Divinity
cards.text:
Enchant creature
As long as enchanted creature is white, it gets +1/+2.
As long as enchanted creature is black, it gets +2/+1.

cards.name: Evershrike
cards.text:
Flying
Evershrike gets +2/+2 for each Aura attached to it.
{X}{W/B}{W/B}: Return Evershrike from your graveyard to the battlefield. You may put an Aura card with converted mana cost X or less from your hand onto the battlefield attached to it. If you don't, exile Evershrike.

cards.name: Gwyllion Hedge-Mage
cards.text:
When Gwyllion Hedge-Mage enters the battlefield, if you control two or more Plains, you may put a 1/1 white Kithkin Soldier creature token onto the battlefield.
When Gwyllion Hedge-Mage enters the battlefield, if you control two or more Swamps, you may put a -1/-1 counter on target creature.

cards.flavor: She speaks only in vile epithets, spitting out curses and obscenities that harm others just by the hearing.
cards.name: Harvest Gwyllion
cards.text: Wither (This deals damage to creatures in the form of -1/-1 counters.)

cards.flavor: A mimic need only touch a being to learn its shape, but touching usually leads to mauling and messily eating.
cards.name: Nightsky Mimic
cards.text: Whenever you cast a spell that's both white and black, Nightsky Mimic has base power and toughness 4/4 until end of turn and gains flying until end of turn.

cards.flavor: Once your life and all your worldly possessions have been surrendered to her, a gwyllion can be surprisingly civilized.
cards.name: Nip Gwyllion
cards.text: Lifelink (Damage dealt by this creature also causes you to gain that much life.)

cards.flavor: They found themselves alive again, still bearing their mortal wounds.
cards.name: Pyrrhic Revival
cards.text: Each player returns each creature card from his or her graveyard to the battlefield with an additional -1/-1 counter on it.

cards.name: Restless Apparition
cards.text:
{W/B}{W/B}{W/B}: Restless Apparition gets +3/+3 until end of turn.
Persist (When this creature dies, if it had no -1/-1 counters on it, return it to the battlefield under its owner's control with a -1/-1 counter on it.)

cards.name: Stillmoon Cavalier
cards.text:
Protection from white and from black
{W/B}: Stillmoon Cavalier gains flying until end of turn.
{W/B}: Stillmoon Cavalier gains first strike until end of turn.
{W/B}{W/B}: Stillmoon Cavalier gets +1/+0 until end of turn.

cards.flavor: A gwyllion's favorite trap is the vanity mirror. A bewitched piece of glass traps the looker's soul and does away with the body.
cards.name: Unmake
cards.text: Exile target creature.

cards.name: Voracious Hatchling
cards.text:
Lifelink
Voracious Hatchling enters the battlefield with four -1/-1 counters on it.
Whenever you cast a white spell, remove a -1/-1 counter from Voracious Hatchling.
Whenever you cast a black spell, remove a -1/-1 counter from Voracious Hatchling.

cards.flavor: It hears and answers every orison across Shadowmoor.
cards.name: Call the Skybreaker
cards.text:
Put a 5/5 blue and red Elemental creature token with flying onto the battlefield.
Retrace (You may cast this card from your graveyard by discarding a land card in addition to paying its other costs.)

cards.name: Clout of the Dominus
cards.text:
Enchant creature
As long as enchanted creature is blue, it gets +1/+1 and has shroud. (It can't be the target of spells or abilities.)
As long as enchanted creature is red, it gets +1/+1 and has haste.

cards.name: Crackleburr
cards.text:
{U/R}{U/R}, {T}, Tap two untapped red creatures you control: Crackleburr deals 3 damage to target creature or player.
{U/R}{U/R}, {Q}, Untap two tapped blue creatures you control: Return target creature to its owner's hand. ({Q} is the untap symbol.)

cards.flavor:
"Be happy when you see a puca shaped like mischief. It's far better than one shaped like death."
—Dindun of Kulrath Mine
cards.name: Crag Puca
cards.text: {U/R}: Switch Crag Puca's power and toughness until end of turn.

cards.flavor:
"Nothing is truly your own. It is his, whether you know it or not."
—The Seer's Parables
cards.name: Dominus of Fealty
cards.text:
Flying
At the beginning of your upkeep, you may gain control of target permanent until end of turn. If you do, untap it and it gains haste until end of turn.

cards.flavor: Seyden's temperament didn't take well to the puca's magic. Nor did his face.
cards.name: Inside Out
cards.text:
Switch target creature's power and toughness until end of turn.
Draw a card.

cards.name: Mindwrack Liege
cards.text:
Other blue creatures you control get +1/+1.
Other red creatures you control get +1/+1.
{U/R}{U/R}{U/R}{U/R}: You may put a blue or red creature card from your hand onto the battlefield.

cards.flavor: Even treefolk witches steer clear of the unpredictable woods near Glen Elendra. Spells refract off the glamer-polished trees and the eyes of lurking pucas.
cards.name: Mirror Sheen
cards.text: {1}{U/R}{U/R}: Copy target instant or sorcery spell that targets you. You may choose new targets for the copy.

cards.flavor: Noggles believe that they were the first race ever to walk Shadowmoor. They don't "steal." They just take back what's rightfully theirs.
cards.name: Noggle Bandit
cards.text: Noggle Bandit can't be blocked except by creatures with defender.

cards.flavor: "It's always funny till someone gets hurt. Then it's hilarious."
cards.name: Noggle Bridgebreaker
cards.text: When Noggle Bridgebreaker enters the battlefield, return a land you control to its owner's hand.

cards.name: Noggle Hedge-Mage
cards.text:
When Noggle Hedge-Mage enters the battlefield, if you control two or more Islands, you may tap two target permanents.
When Noggle Hedge-Mage enters the battlefield, if you control two or more Mountains, you may have Noggle Hedge-Mage deal 2 damage to target player.

cards.flavor: Noggles live purely by what they can scavenge. There is not a single thing a noggle eats, wears, or uses that did not once belong to another.
cards.name: Noggle Ransacker
cards.text: When Noggle Ransacker enters the battlefield, each player draws two cards, then discards a card at random.

cards.flavor: It loathes all tastes but two: spells and flesh.
cards.name: Nucklavee
cards.text:
When Nucklavee enters the battlefield, you may return target red sorcery card from your graveyard to your hand.
When Nucklavee enters the battlefield, you may return target blue instant card from your graveyard to your hand.

cards.flavor: Mimics don't hide their natural form well, but their disguises work well enough on boggarts.
cards.name: Riverfall Mimic
cards.text: Whenever you cast a spell that's both blue and red, Riverfall Mimic has base power and toughness 3/3 until end of turn and can't be blocked this turn.

cards.name: Shrewd Hatchling
cards.text:
Shrewd Hatchling enters the battlefield with four -1/-1 counters on it.
{U/R}: Target creature can't block Shrewd Hatchling this turn.
Whenever you cast a blue spell, remove a -1/-1 counter from Shrewd Hatchling.
Whenever you cast a red spell, remove a -1/-1 counter from Shrewd Hatchling.

cards.flavor: Like many who dwell in Shadowmoor now, he was robbed of his better half by the Aurora.
cards.name: Stream Hopper
cards.text: {U/R}: Stream Hopper gains flying until end of turn.

cards.flavor: The scales of battle rarely balance.
cards.name: Unnerving Assault
cards.text: Creatures your opponents control get -1/-0 until end of turn if {U} was spent to cast Unnerving Assault, and creatures you control get +1/+0 until end of turn if {R} was spent to cast it. (Do both if {U}{R} was spent.)

cards.flavor: Once the hideous disease takes hold, it spreads through both bark and mind.
cards.name: Canker Abomination
cards.text: As Canker Abomination enters the battlefield, choose an opponent. Canker Abomination enters the battlefield with a -1/-1 counter on it for each creature that player controls.

cards.flavor: Nothing warms the bark on a chilly day like a draught of elf.
cards.name: Cankerous Thirst
cards.text: If {B} was spent to cast Cankerous Thirst, you may have target creature get -3/-3 until end of turn. If {G} was spent to cast Cankerous Thirst, you may have target creature get +3/+3 until end of turn. (Do both if {B}{G} was spent.)

cards.name: Creakwood Liege
cards.text:
Other black creatures you control get +1/+1.
Other green creatures you control get +1/+1.
At the beginning of your upkeep, you may put a 1/1 black and green Worm creature token onto the battlefield.

cards.flavor:
"His skin cuts swords."
—The Seer's Parables
cards.name: Deity of Scars
cards.text:
Trample
Deity of Scars enters the battlefield with two -1/-1 counters on it.
{B/G}, Remove a -1/-1 counter from Deity of Scars: Regenerate Deity of Scars.

cards.flavor: Loose earth is not a burial but an appetizer.
cards.name: Desecrator Hag
cards.text: When Desecrator Hag enters the battlefield, return to your hand the creature card in your graveyard with the greatest power. If two or more cards are tied for greatest power, you choose one of them.

cards.flavor: It eats and eats until the juiciest morsel it can find is itself.
cards.name: Doomgape
cards.text:
Trample
At the beginning of your upkeep, sacrifice a creature. You gain life equal to that creature's toughness.

cards.flavor: Trows have learned that it's not wise to eat cinders without a bucket or two of water nearby.
cards.name: Drain the Well
cards.text: Destroy target land. You gain 2 life.

cards.name: Gift of the Deity
cards.text:
Enchant creature
As long as enchanted creature is black, it gets +1/+1 and has deathtouch. (Any amount of damage it deals to a creature is enough to destroy that creature.)
As long as enchanted creature is green, it gets +1/+1 and all creatures able to block it do so.

cards.name: Hag Hedge-Mage
cards.text:
When Hag Hedge-Mage enters the battlefield, if you control two or more Swamps, you may have target player discard a card.
When Hag Hedge-Mage enters the battlefield, if you control two or more Forests, you may put target card from your graveyard on top of your library.

cards.name: Noxious Hatchling
cards.text:
Noxious Hatchling enters the battlefield with four -1/-1 counters on it.
Wither (This deals damage to creatures in the form of -1/-1 counters.)
Whenever you cast a black spell, remove a -1/-1 counter from Noxious Hatchling.
Whenever you cast a green spell, remove a -1/-1 counter from Noxious Hatchling.

cards.flavor: Trows are the vile trolls that lurk in the bogs of Shadowmoor. They reappear each night to frighten the living and gnaw the dead.
cards.name: Odious Trow
cards.text: {1}{B/G}: Regenerate Odious Trow.

cards.flavor: While it's true that a quillspike does heal the sick, it's just because it finds them tastier that way.
cards.name: Quillspike
cards.text: {B/G}, Remove a -1/-1 counter from a creature you control: Quillspike gets +3/+3 until end of turn.

cards.name: Rendclaw Trow
cards.text:
Wither (This deals damage to creatures in the form of -1/-1 counters.)
Persist (When this creature dies, if it had no -1/-1 counters on it, return it to the battlefield under its owner's control with a -1/-1 counter on it.)

cards.flavor: Her plans may yet bear fruit.
cards.name: Sapling of Colfenor
cards.text:
Indestructible
Whenever Sapling of Colfenor attacks, reveal the top card of your library. If it's a creature card, you gain life equal to that card's toughness, lose life equal to its power, then put it into your hand.

cards.flavor: Her hunt is silent until a bone snaps or flesh tears. Her victims never know to scream.
cards.name: Stalker Hag
cards.text: Swampwalk, forestwalk (This creature can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a Swamp or a Forest.)

cards.flavor: A mimic's disguise fools its victims just long enough to draw them within range of its venomous tentacles.
cards.name: Woodlurker Mimic
cards.text: Whenever you cast a spell that's both black and green, Woodlurker Mimic has base power and toughness 4/5 until end of turn and gains wither until end of turn. (It deals damage to creatures in the form of -1/-1 counters.)

cards.name: Worm Harvest
cards.text:
Put a 1/1 black and green Worm creature token onto the battlefield for each land card in your graveyard.
Retrace (You may cast this card from your graveyard by discarding a land card in addition to paying its other costs.)

cards.name: Balefire Liege
cards.text:
Other red creatures you control get +1/+1.
Other white creatures you control get +1/+1.
Whenever you cast a red spell, Balefire Liege deals 3 damage to target player.
Whenever you cast a white spell, you gain 3 life.

cards.flavor: Mimics don't need perfect disguises. They need only the perfect victims: the naive, the young, or the poor of sight.
cards.name: Battlegate Mimic
cards.text: Whenever you cast a spell that's both red and white, Battlegate Mimic has base power and toughness 4/2 until end of turn and gains first strike until end of turn.

cards.name: Belligerent Hatchling
cards.text:
First strike
Belligerent Hatchling enters the battlefield with four -1/-1 counters on it.
Whenever you cast a red spell, remove a -1/-1 counter from Belligerent Hatchling.
Whenever you cast a white spell, remove a -1/-1 counter from Belligerent Hatchling.

cards.flavor: "When in doubt, kill 'em twice."
cards.name: Double Cleave
cards.text: Target creature gains double strike until end of turn. (It deals both first-strike and regular combat damage.)

cards.flavor: Some duergars dismiss the world above as a fable. They react violently when their comfortable illusions are dispelled.
cards.name: Duergar Assailant
cards.text: Sacrifice Duergar Assailant: Duergar Assailant deals 1 damage to target attacking or blocking creature.

cards.name: Duergar Hedge-Mage
cards.text:
When Duergar Hedge-Mage enters the battlefield, if you control two or more Mountains, you may destroy target artifact.
When Duergar Hedge-Mage enters the battlefield, if you control two or more Plains, you may destroy target enchantment.

cards.flavor: Duergars are prodigious workers with long memories. Some still fulfill intricately detailed orders given decades, if not centuries, before.
cards.name: Duergar Mine-Captain
cards.text: {1}{R/W}, {Q}: Attacking creatures get +1/+0 until end of turn. ({Q} is the untap symbol.)

cards.name: Figure of Destiny
cards.text:
{R/W}: Figure of Destiny becomes a Kithkin Spirit with base power and toughness 2/2.
{R/W}{R/W}{R/W}: If Figure of Destiny is a Spirit, it becomes a Kithkin Spirit Warrior with base power and toughness 4/4.
{R/W}{R/W}{R/W}{R/W}{R/W}{R/W}: If Figure of Destiny is a Warrior, it becomes a Kithkin Spirit Warrior Avatar with base power and toughness 8/8, flying, and first strike.

cards.flavor: "Make these shots count. The more foes we drop now, the fewer we'll have trying to kill us later."
cards.name: Fire at Will
cards.text: Fire at Will deals 3 damage divided as you choose among one, two, or three target attacking or blocking creatures.

cards.flavor: Hobgoblins are best left alone. They sharpen their farm implements far more than is necessary for their work in the fields.
cards.name: Hearthfire Hobgoblin
cards.text: Double strike

cards.flavor: The faeries snickered at first. A common hob in Oona's skies? But his lance ended their mockery, and now the sound of a cicada's wings brings a shudder to the faerie heart.
cards.name: Hobgoblin Dragoon
cards.text: Flying, first strike

cards.name: Moonhold
cards.text: Target player can't play land cards this turn if {R} was spent to cast Moonhold and can't play creature cards this turn if {W} was spent to cast it. (Do both if {R}{W} was spent.)

cards.flavor:
"A great siege is a banquet to him; a long and terrible battle, the most exquisite delicacy."
—The Seer's Parables
cards.name: Nobilis of War
cards.text:
Flying
Attacking creatures you control get +2/+0.

cards.flavor: A river even the merrow dare not cross.
cards.name: Rise of the Hobgoblins
cards.text:
When Rise of the Hobgoblins enters the battlefield, you may pay {X}. If you do, put X 1/1 red and white Goblin Soldier creature tokens onto the battlefield.
{R/W}: Red creatures and white creatures you control gain first strike until end of turn.

cards.name: Scourge of the Nobilis
cards.text:
Enchant creature
As long as enchanted creature is red, it gets +1/+1 and has "{R/W}: This creature gets +1/+0 until end of turn."
As long as enchanted creature is white, it gets +1/+1 and has lifelink. (Damage dealt by the creature also causes its controller to gain that much life.)

cards.flavor:
"I knew a creature carved from a dream of wild freedom. Any attempt to leash or exploit it failed, and at terrible cost."
—Ashling
cards.name: Spitemare
cards.text: Whenever Spitemare is dealt damage, it deals that much damage to target creature or player.

cards.name: Waves of Aggression
cards.text:
Untap all creatures that attacked this turn. After this main phase, there is an additional combat phase followed by an additional main phase.
Retrace (You may cast this card from your graveyard by discarding a land card in addition to paying its other costs.)

cards.flavor: She follows the old tributaries built when merrows still shaped the tides.
cards.name: Cold-Eyed Selkie
cards.text:
Islandwalk (This creature can't be blocked as long as defending player controls an Island.) 
Whenever Cold-Eyed Selkie deals combat damage to a player, you may draw that many cards.

cards.flavor: The forest grew fangs. The sky spread its wings.
cards.name: Fable of Wolf and Owl
cards.text:
Whenever you cast a green spell, you may put a 2/2 green Wolf creature token onto the battlefield.
Whenever you cast a blue spell, you may put a 1/1 blue Bird creature token with flying onto the battlefield.

cards.flavor: Enlightenment is the mundane seen from the vantage point of the divine.
cards.name: Favor of the Overbeing
cards.text:
Enchant creature
As long as enchanted creature is green, it gets +1/+1 and has vigilance.
As long as enchanted creature is blue, it gets +1/+1 and has flying.

cards.flavor: Do the glowing trinkets show it the way home, or do they set a twisted path for someone else to follow?
cards.name: Gilder Bairn
cards.text: {2}{G/U}, {Q}: For each counter on target permanent, put another of those counters on that permanent. ({Q} is the untap symbol.)

cards.name: Grazing Kelpie
cards.text:
{G/U}, Sacrifice Grazing Kelpie: Put target card from a graveyard on the bottom of its owner's library.
Persist (When this creature dies, if it had no -1/-1 counters on it, return it to the battlefield under its owner's control with a -1/-1 counter on it.)

cards.flavor: Endry was determined to teach his groundlings a few winged-faerie tricks.
cards.name: Groundling Pouncer
cards.text: {G/U}: Groundling Pouncer gets +1/+3 and gains flying until end of turn. Activate this ability only once each turn and only if an opponent controls a creature with flying.

cards.name: Invert the Skies
cards.text: Creatures your opponents control lose flying until end of turn if {G} was spent to cast Invert the Skies, and creatures you control gain flying until end of turn if {U} was spent to cast it. (Do both if {G}{U} was spent.)

cards.name: Murkfiend Liege
cards.text:
Other green creatures you control get +1/+1.
Other blue creatures you control get +1/+1.
Untap all green and/or blue creatures you control during each other player's untap step.

cards.flavor:
"She walks among us unseen, learning from our imperfections."
—The Seer's Parables
cards.name: Overbeing of Myth
cards.text:
Overbeing of Myth's power and toughness are each equal to the number of cards in your hand.
At the beginning of your draw step, draw an additional card.

cards.name: Selkie Hedge-Mage
cards.text:
When Selkie Hedge-Mage enters the battlefield, if you control two or more Forests, you may gain 3 life.
When Selkie Hedge-Mage enters the battlefield, if you control two or more Islands, you may return target tapped creature to its owner's hand.

cards.flavor: The Aurora replaced the changelings' innocence with malice and their curiosity with hunger.
cards.name: Shorecrasher Mimic
cards.text: Whenever you cast a spell that's both green and blue, Shorecrasher Mimic has base power and toughness 5/3 until end of turn and gains trample until end of turn.

cards.flavor: Bogles are very tasty if you can get the skin off. It's getting a blade on them that's the problem.
cards.name: Slippery Bogle
cards.text: Hexproof (This creature can't be the target of spells or abilities your opponents control.)

cards.flavor: Losing his possessions distressed him, but the lack of limbs was strangely liberating.
cards.name: Snakeform
cards.text:
Until end of turn, target creature loses all abilities and becomes a green Snake with base power and toughness 1/1.
Draw a card.

cards.flavor: Spitting is the customary greeting between a creature and its magical impostor.
cards.name: Spitting Image
cards.text:
Put a token that's a copy of target creature onto the battlefield.
Retrace (You may cast this card from your graveyard by discarding a land card in addition to paying its other costs.)

cards.name: Sturdy Hatchling
cards.text:
Sturdy Hatchling enters the battlefield with four -1/-1 counters on it.
{G/U}: Sturdy Hatchling gains shroud until end of turn. (It can't be the target of spells or abilities.)
Whenever you cast a green spell, remove a -1/-1 counter from Sturdy Hatchling.
Whenever you cast a blue spell, remove a -1/-1 counter from Sturdy Hatchling.

cards.flavor: Travelers in these waters leave a bit of themselves behind.
cards.name: Trapjaw Kelpie
cards.text:
Flash
Persist (When this creature dies, if it had no -1/-1 counters on it, return it to the battlefield under its owner's control with a -1/-1 counter on it.)

cards.flavor: Selkies call to a sea they never swam, in a tongue they never spoke, with a song they never learned.
cards.name: Wistful Selkie
cards.text: When Wistful Selkie enters the battlefield, draw a card.

cards.name: Altar Golem
cards.text:
Trample
Altar Golem's power and toughness are each equal to the number of creatures on the battlefield.
Altar Golem doesn't untap during your untap step.
Tap five untapped creatures you control: Untap Altar Golem.

cards.flavor: Every skull has a tale to tell, and a skulkin is many dire tales cobbled together.
cards.name: Antler Skulkin
cards.text: {2}: Target white creature gains persist until end of turn. (When it dies, if it had no -1/-1 counters on it, return it to the battlefield under its owner's control with a -1/-1 counter on it.)

cards.flavor:
"Everything falls apart. But living things fall apart in the most fascinating ways."
—Mowagh the Gwyllion
cards.name: Fang Skulkin
cards.text: {2}: Target black creature gains wither until end of turn. (It deals damage to creatures in the form of -1/-1 counters.)

cards.flavor: It hunts with the memory of a long lost herd.
cards.name: Hoof Skulkin
cards.text: {3}: Target green creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn.

cards.flavor:
"Ah, skull of shrew—a very potent substance. In powdered form, it gives thrice the zing of noggle hoof pulp."
—Boghald, Barrenton medic
cards.name: Jawbone Skulkin
cards.text: {2}: Target red creature gains haste until end of turn.

cards.flavor: The banner was not a symbol of victory, but a herald of the carnage to come.
cards.name: Leering Emblem
cards.text:
Whenever you cast a spell, equipped creature gets +2/+2 until end of turn.
Equip {2}

cards.flavor: Her poppets bring joy to the truly depraved.
cards.name: Scarecrone
cards.text:
{1}, Sacrifice a Scarecrow: Draw a card.
{4}, {T}: Return target artifact creature card from your graveyard to the battlefield.

cards.flavor: Skulkins confer strange benefits on unsuspecting patrons.
cards.name: Shell Skulkin
cards.text: {3}: Target blue creature gains shroud until end of turn. (It can't be the target of spells or abilities.)

cards.flavor: Mages dare not attempt magic in its grotesque presence.
cards.name: Ward of Bones
cards.text: Each opponent who controls more creatures than you can't play creature cards. The same is true for artifacts, enchantments, and lands.

cards.flavor: Travelers bathe in the falls to wash away curses from the pucas who lurk nearby.
cards.name: Cascade Bluffs
cards.text:
{T}: Add {1} to your mana pool.
{U/R}, {T}: Add {U}{U}, {U}{R}, or {R}{R} to your mana pool.

cards.flavor:
"Do not linger in such places, child. There the gwyllions dance. If they find you, you will join in their revels for eternity."
—Talara, elvish safewright
cards.name: Fetid Heath
cards.text:
{T}: Add {1} to your mana pool.
{W/B}, {T}: Add {W}{W}, {W}{B}, or {B}{B} to your mana pool.

cards.flavor: At full moon, the river seeps over its banks and crawls through the woods like a blanket of serpents.
cards.name: Flooded Grove
cards.text:
{T}: Add {1} to your mana pool.
{G/U}, {T}: Add {G}{G}, {G}{U}, or {U}{U} to your mana pool.

cards.flavor: Hobs bury their kin far from home. They believe the dry, open ground keeps hags from stealing the bones and gwyllions from stealing the spirits.
cards.name: Rugged Prairie
cards.text:
{T}: Add {1} to your mana pool.
{R/W}, {T}: Add {R}{R}, {R}{W}, or {W}{W} to your mana pool.

cards.name: Springjack Pasture
cards.text:
{T}: Add {1} to your mana pool.
{4}, {T}: Put a 0/1 white Goat creature token onto the battlefield.
{T}, Sacrifice X Goats: Add X mana of any one color to your mana pool. You gain X life.

cards.flavor: As their roots soaked in a weak tea of bogwater and decay, the trees absorbed the essence of death into their living tissue.
cards.name: Twilight Mire
cards.text:
{T}: Add {1} to your mana pool.
{B/G}, {T}: Add {B}{B}, {B}{G}, or {G}{G} to your mana pool.
